subject: Productivity
title: Sunk Cost Fallacy
description: Learn Sunk Cost Fallacy in one minute.

hook.text: You sit through a terrible movie because you paid for the ticket. The money is gone either way.

buildup.text: The sunk cost fallacy means continuing something because of what you already invested, not future value.

discovery.text: Rational decisions should ignore past costs. Only future benefits and costs matter.

twist.text: The Concorde jet kept flying despite losses because two governments refused to admit the project failed.

climax.text: Letting go of sunk costs feels like losing. But holding on guarantees bigger losses.

punchline.text: Don't cling to a mistake because you spent time making it.

quiz.question: What is the sunk cost fallacy?
options: Continuing something because of past investment, not future value
